Andre, what build and do you get the walkback consistently?
Can you prove that it is or is not Mac related?

It seems like it is Mac-related based on what Andre indicates.  Can the 
clientAreaHeight ever be negative on the Mac?  Based on the value that Andre is 
seeing and based on how that value is calculated, this is our best guess as to 
why the problem is occurring. 

Andre, in handleResize, could you put a println statement when oldHeight is < 
0?  If this occurs, then the clientAreaHeight is the problem.

Yes, in StyledText.handleResize whenever oldHeight was < 0, 
ContentWidthCache.calculate would throw the ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.
The reason for oldHeight being < 0 is that a native method in Scrollable.getClientArea 
sometimes returns negative values. If I clamp these value to be >= 0 StyledText no longer 
produces the ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

Steve, is getClientArea allowed to return negative values?

I'm surprised StyledText doesn't crash in other places. We assumed that 
getClientArea never returns negative values. Technically a bad assumption, 
since getClientArea isn't spec'd that way. I noticed that other widgets do test 
for clientArea.height <= 0 and not just 0.

Either the spec needs to be updated if getClientArea really is not supposed to 
return negative values or we need to review our code.

getClientArea() can never return a negative width or height.  It could in 
theory return a negative x and y but this would mean that the origin was above 
the top left corner of the control and this never happens.

Fix the Mac to never return negative values?
Reassigning to Andre.  If you need us to do something, let us know.
